enhanced_by.reason: The wrap method initializes a ControllableInputStream, which is necessary for the readToByteBuffer method to operate correctly.
Setting up progress tracking with onProgress can provide additional context and state management before reading to a ByteBuffer.
The emitProgress method tracks and reports progress, which can be used to assert the state of the read operation during testing.
The baseReadFully method checks if the underlying InputStream has been fully read, which can be used to assert the completion of the read operation.
